alert.note: Alert for Champaign (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 12:40AM CDT until September 19 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PIATT...NORTHEASTERN DE WITT...EASTERN MCLEAN AND NORTHWESTERN CHAMPAIGN COUNTIES... At 1238 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Saybrook, or 11 miles southwest of Gibson City, moving southeast at 45 mph. A tornado warning is also in effect for southeast McLean, northeast Dewitt and northern Piatt counties until 1 am cdt. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Mansfield and Fisher. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 between mile markers 156 and 159, and between mile markers 167 and 181. Interstate 74 between mile markers 132 and 155, near mile marker 158, and between mile markers 162 and 169. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
